result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik M Franks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court set restitution at zero.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Third party contact for the purpose of time with children,
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

No contact with CSJ unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malik M Franks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appeared by video for Malik M Franks.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/ Sentencing Hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court vacates the previous plea and judgement of conviction entered on 08/22/2022.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other case, with Huber release privileges to be determined by HOC, with credit for 26 days served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with CSJ unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- No contact with firearms.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.


*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 09/02/2022.

Defendant Malik M Franks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appeared by video for Malik M Franks.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Sentencing Hearing. Discussion with parties put forth on the record, regarding discrepancies in the extended offer provided by the state. Court had reservations regarding the defendant entering his sentencing under such circumstances. Court stopped proceedings and adjourned case for this afternoon to allow parties to speak further regarding resolution. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Malik M Franks in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Defendant Malik M Franks in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Jury Trial.

Defense counsel advises that there has been a change in circumstances and the parties are now in a resolution posture. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Malik M Franks in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Malik M Franks in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malik M Franks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
